turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Treadstone.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Never heard of it.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: That's not gonna fly.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: With all due respect, Pam, I think you might've wandered a little past your pay-grade.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: And what are we looking for?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: I want to know about Treadstone.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: To know about it?  It was a kill squad. Black on black. Closed down two years ago. Nobody wants to know about Treadstone. Not around here.  You better take this back to Marty and make sure he knows what you're doing.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: He does. I've been down to the archives. I have the files, Ward.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Let's talk about Conklin.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: What are you after, Pam? You want to fry me? You want my desk? Is that it?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: I want to know what happened.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: What happened? Jason Bourne happened.  You've got the files? Then let's cut the crap. It went wrong. Conklin had these guys wound so tight they were bound to snap. Bourne was his number one -- guy went out to work, screwed the op and never came back. Conklin couldn't fix it, couldn't find Bourne, couldn't adjust. It all went sideways. Finally there were no options left.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: So you had Conklin killed.  I mean, if we're cutting the crap...

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: I've given thirty years and two marriages to this agency. I've shoveled shit on four continents. I'm due to retire next year and believe me, I need my pension, but if you think I'm gonna sit here and let you dangle me with this, you can go to hell. Marshall too.  It had to be done.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: And Bourne? Where's he now?

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Dead in a ditch? Drunk in a bar in Mogadishu? Who knows?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: I think I do. We had a deal going down in Berlin last week. During the buy, both our Field Agent and the seller were killed. We pulled a fingerprint from a timing charge that didn't go off.  They were killed by Jason Bourne.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: ...Ivan Mevedev -- senior financial manager -- worked for one of the new Russian petroleum companies, Pecos Oil. He claimed to know where the money landed. We believe this could have only happened with help from someone inside the Agency... This...

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: ...this is Conklin's computer.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: ...At the time of his death, Conklin was sitting on a personal account in the amount of seven-hundred and sixty thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Do you know what his budget was?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: We were throwing money at him. Throwing it at him and asking him to keep it dark.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: May I finish?

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Conklin might've been a nut, but he wasn't a mole. You have me his calendar for a couple of days, I'll prove he killed Lincoln.  This is supposed to be definitive?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: What's definitive, is that I just lost two people in Berlin!

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: So what's your theory?  Conklin's reaching out from the grave to protect his good name?  The man is dead.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Berlin!

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: I've already got a team there. I doubt Bourne's in Naples to settle down and raise a family.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: You don't know what you're getting into here.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: And you do? From the moment he left Treadstone, he has killed and eluded every person that you sent to find him...

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Call a Mayday into Berlin station. We need snipers, DOD, whatever they got. Snipers?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Hold on -- he said he wants to come in.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: My ass he does. You're playing with fire, Pamela. Marshall said nail him to the wall. I don't know how you interpreted that, but I don't think he meant repatriate him.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Don't you want answers?

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: There are no answers. There's either Jason Bourne alive or Jason Bourne dead. And I for one would prefer the latter. And what about her?  You just send her out to this lunatic with no protection?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: So what's he doing? You believe him?

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: It's hard to swallow.  The confusion -- the amnesia -- but he keeps on killing? It's more calculated than sick.  What about Nicky? She's the last one to see Bourne in Paris. She's the one he asks for. They disappear...

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Well, whatever he's doing, I've had enough -- this is now a search and destroy mission.  I want the Berlin police fully briefed and --  -- get this out to all the agencies.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Sorry to wake you.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: I wasn't sleeping.  You OK?

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: They found Danny Zorn's body. Dead in the basement at the building where my people got hit the first time.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Oh, God... It must have been Bourne.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Did he say anything to you?

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: No... It must have been Bourne.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Moscow? What the Hell's he going to Moscow for?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Don't know.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Jesus... I, Zorn... I have to call his family. Tell them...

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: I'm sorry, Ward.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Sit down.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: I'd rather stand if it's all the same to you.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: I don't exactly know what to say -- I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: 'Why' would be enough for me.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: I'm not a traitor. I've served my ountry.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: And pocketed a fair amount of change while doing it.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Why not? It was just money.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: And Danny Zorn, what was that?

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Had to be done.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: No good options left?

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: In the end, honestly, it's hubris. Simple hubris. You reach a point in this game when the only satisfaction left is to see how clever you are.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: No. You lost your way.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Well, you're probably right. I guess that's all that hubris is.

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: Sir...

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: She say what time I should call?

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: The sooner the better.

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: I did my box work, but I wanted to show you before I showed Landy. I came out here last night because none of this was making any sense. I mean, I'm with you on this, Conklin was a nut, but a traitor? I just can't get there.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: What do you have, Danny?

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: You put a four-gam Kel on here and it's gonna take out power to the building. You know that. What you can't know, is if it's gonna blow the room with it.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: There were two charges, they were supposed to go off simultaneously. The second one, the one that didn't go off, was down here...  First of all, this is nothing, it's a sub-line for the breaker above. Second, why put the charge all the way down here? If you're good enough to get in here and handle the gear, you're good enough to know you don't need this.  Bourne would know.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: It was staged?

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: Is it a slam dunk? No, but...

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Jesus...

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: Okay. What if someone decided to cover their tracks by blaming Conklin and Bourne. What if Bourne didn't have anything to do with this?

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Keep going...

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: Something's been going on here in Europe. And it's still going on. Post Conklin. Who's been in Berlin?

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Lots of people...

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: Including Landy...  She had access to the archives.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Who else knows about this?

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: Nobody. You.  I had to tell you, right?

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Show me again...

turns.speaker: ZORN
turns.text: Okay...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Sit. Can you...  [The chair. Have the chair.]

turns.speaker: IRENA
turns.text: I speak English.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Of all the people in the world, you're the only one I have anything to offer.  That's why I came here.

turns.speaker: IRENA
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: It's nice.  Does this picture mean anything to you?  Hmm?

turns.speaker: IRENA
turns.text: It's nothing. It's just a picture.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: No. It's because you don't know how they died.

turns.speaker: IRENA
turns.text: No, I do.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I would want to know.  I would want to know that my mother didn't kill my father. I would want to know that she didn't kill herself.

turns.speaker: IRENA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: It changes things. That knowledge. Doesn't it?

turns.speaker: IRENA
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: That's not what happened to your parents.

turns.speaker: IRENA
turns.text: Then what?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I killed them.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: It was my job. My first time. Your father was supposed to be alone. But then your mother, she came out of nowhere...  I had to change my plan.  You understand me?  You don't have to live like that anymore. Thinking that.

turns.speaker: IRENA
turns.text: You killed them.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: They loved you.  And I killed them.

turns.speaker: IRENA
turns.text: How... how can... how can you be here and say this?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I don't want you to forgive me.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: It doesn't matter. Your life is hard enough.

turns.speaker: IRENA
turns.text: You're a liar.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: You know I'm not.

turns.speaker: IRENA
turns.text: YOU'RE A LIAR!

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Look at me.

turns.speaker: IRENA
turns.text: I should kill you... if it's true you should die... I should kill you now!

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I can't let you do that either.

turns.speaker: IRENA
turns.text: Because you're afraid!

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: No.  Because you don't want to know how it feels.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I have to go now.

turns.speaker: IRENA
turns.text: Is this really happening?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I emptied it.

turns.speaker: JARDA
turns.text: Felt a little light.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Drop it.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Front. Use your teeth.

turns.speaker: JARDA
turns.text: Sorry. Old habits.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: You still should've moved.

turns.speaker: JARDA
turns.text: I like it here.  Last time I saw you was Greece. You had a good spot.

turns.speaker: JARDA
turns.text: So why didn't you kill me then?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: She wouldn't let me.  She's the only reason you're alive.

turns.speaker: JARDA
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Conklin.

turns.speaker: JARDA
turns.text: He's dead.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Try again.

turns.speaker: JARDA
turns.text: Shot dead in Paris. Dead the night you walked out.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: You're lying. If it's over, why are they after me?

turns.speaker: JARDA
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Who sent you to Greece?

turns.speaker: JARDA
turns.text: A voice. A voice from the States. Someone new.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Pamela Landy?

turns.speaker: JARDA
turns.text: I don't know who that is.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: What's going on in Berlin?

turns.speaker: JARDA
turns.text: I don't know! Why would I lie?

turns.speaker: JARDA
turns.text: She really did that? Told you not to kill me?  I had a woman once. But after a while, what do you talk about? I mean, for us. The work. You can't tell them who you are...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I did.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: You called it in?

turns.speaker: JARDA
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: How long? How long do I have --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- car keys?

turns.speaker: JARDA
turns.text: -- my coat -- but we should --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- what? --

turns.speaker: JARDA
turns.text: -- take the back -- get another car --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Where were you, Jason? In the car.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Conklin up front.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: I'll get the book.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: No. There's nothing new.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: You're sure?  We should still -- we should write it down.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Two years we're scribbling in a notebook --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- it hasn't been two years --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- it's always bad and it's never anything but bits and pieces anyway!  You ever think that maybe it's just making it worse? You don't wonder that?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: We write them down because sooner or later you're going to remember something good.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I do remember something good. All the time. I remember you.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I'm trying, Marie, Okay?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: I worry when you get like this.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: It's just a nightmare.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: I don't mean that. I worry when you try to ignore it.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Sleep. Sleep now.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I should be better by now.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: You are better. And I think it's not memories at all. It's just a dream you keep having over and over.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: But it ends up the same.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: One day it will be different. It just takes time.  We'll make new memories. You and me.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: No... How?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: The Telegraph office.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: But we were so careful.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: We pushed it. We got lazy.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: But you're sure?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: He was at the campground yesterday.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: So...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: It's wrong. Guy with a rental car and hundred dollar sneakers sleeps in a tent?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: That's crazy.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: No. Not this. This is real.  And he's right there...

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Where --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Back there -- at the corner -- Hyundai -- silver --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: ...but you're not -- you're not sure...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: We can't wait to be sure.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: I don't want to move again... I like it here.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Look, we clear out, we get to the shack, we get safe. We hang there awhile. I'll come back. I'll check it out. But right now we can't --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- where's left to go? --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- there's places -- we can't afford to be wrong!

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: You drive.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Switch! You drive!

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- where? -

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- make the left -- toward the bridge --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Jesus! --  -- is he back there? --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- not yet --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- it's just him? --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: -- yeah -- one guy -- I don't think he was ready --

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: -- hang on --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: You keep going to the shack. I'll meet you there in an hour.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I'm going to bail on the other side and wait. This bridge is the only way he can follow.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: What if it's not who you think it is?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: If he crosses the bridge, it is.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: There must be another way!

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I warned them, Marie. I told them to leave us alone.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Jason, please don't do this...it won't ever be over like this.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: There's no choice.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: I love you, too.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Tell me later.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I wanted to kill him.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: But you found another choice.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I did.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: It wouldn't have changed the way you feel.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: It might have.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I know it's a dream.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I only dream about people who are dead.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: God, I miss you. I don't know what to do without you.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Jason. You know exactly what to do. That is your mission now.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: See that tram coming around the corner?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Get on it.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I did... Jason, I swear, I did... I told them... I told them I believed you...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Who is Pamela Landy?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You hear me? I believed you.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: IS SHE RUNNING TREADSTONE?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Why is she trying to kill me?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: They know!  They know you were here. They know you killed these two guys. They know you and Conklin had something on the side. They don't know what it is, but they know!

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: How do they know that? How can they know any of that?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What is this, a game?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I want to hear it from you.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Say it.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Last week an Agency field officer went to make a buy from a Russian national.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: A Russian?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: It was Pamela Landy's op. The guy was going to sell-out a mole or something. I haven't been debriefed on exactly what it was.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Last week? When?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: And you got to him before we could.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I killed him???

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You left a print! There was Kel that didn't go off! There was a partial print, they tracked it back to Treadstone! They know it's you!

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I left a fingerprint! You fucking people.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: What was Landy buying? What kind of files?  WHAT WAS SHE BUYING?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Conklin! Stuff on Conklin!

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Why are you here, then?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Please -- I'm only here because of Paris -- because they can't figure out what you're doing -- I'm here because of Abbott --

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Abbott?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: He closed down Treadstone -- he took care of me after Paris...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: So when was I here?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: For Treadstone. In Berlin. You know my file. I did a job here. When?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: No. You never worked Berlin.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: My first job.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Your first assignment was Geneva.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: That's a lie!

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You never worked Berlin...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: No... Jason... please...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I was here!

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: ...it's not in the file... I swear... I know your file... your first job was Geneva!... I swear to God you never worked here!...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: It's me.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Bourne?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I want to come in.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Okay, how do you want to do it?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: I want someone I know to take me in.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: There was a girl in Paris. Part of the program. She used to handle the medication.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Okay, Jason, your move.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Alexanderplatz. 30 minutes. Under the World Clock. Alone. Give her your phone.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Where am I?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Ramstein Air Base, Germany.  Before the wall fell you would have woken up in a Russian prison hospital.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Oh, shit...

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Careful...

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Why am I alive?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Are you disappointed?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Thank you for your gift. I'm sorry about Marie.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Do you think you can read? Are you well enough?

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: Don't need it. I remember everything.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Sounds like a threat.

turns.speaker: BOURNE
turns.text: You didn't answer my question.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Why you're alive?  You're alive because you're special. Because she kept you alive.  Because we want you back on our side.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: We need to get in there.

turns.speaker: CRONIN
turns.text: I'm working on it.

turns.speaker: CRONIN
turns.text: -- so there were two of these explosive charges placed on the power lines. One of them failed. The fingerprint...  That's from the one that didn't go off.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: And the Germans can't match it?

turns.speaker: CRONIN
turns.text: Looks like he's been detained.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Who's going? Us?

turns.speaker: CRONIN
turns.text: There's only a Consulate, they sent a field officer out half an hour ago --

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Then get a number, they need to know who they're dealing with.

turns.speaker: CRONIN
turns.text: -- Kurt's reopening all the wyfi and sat links --

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: -- uplink all relevant files to Kim --  -- and I want them to contact anyone who had anything to do with Treadstone --

turns.speaker: CRONIN
turns.text: -- go -- take the van! --

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: -- the hotel -- how far? --

turns.speaker: CRONIN
turns.text: Maybe he just needed a place to spend the night?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: I want to look at the room.  Check it out.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Alright... take it down.

turns.speaker: CRONIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: This stays between you and I.  We finally have an edge. I don't want to lose it.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: We'll know for sure when we get the security tapes.

turns.speaker: CRONIN
turns.text: But we can relax. We tracked him. He's on a train to Moscow.

turns.speaker: CRONIN
turns.text: You're sure?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: What? The tapes?

turns.speaker: CRONIN
turns.text: Hold on...  Yep. And Abbott just direct dialed Moscow from his room...

turns.speaker: IVAN
turns.text: Show me.

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: Here?

turns.speaker: IVAN
turns.text: Now. Show now.

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: This is everything? Is there.

turns.speaker: IVAN
turns.text: Is there. Is all there.

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: -- who? -- who else is here? --

turns.speaker: IVAN
turns.text: -- no! -- not me! -- no other people! --

turns.speaker: VIC
turns.text: -- shut up! -- just shut the --

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: I'm here. So is Donnie and Jack Weller. We understand you're using the full allocation for this buy?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: That's where we came out.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: It's a lot of money, Pam.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: We're talking raw, unprocessed KGB files. It's not something we can go out and comparison shop.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Still...

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: For a thief. A mole. I vetted the source, Marty. He's real. If it does nothing more than narrow the list of suspects, it's a bargain at ten times the price.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Okay, cut to the chase, Pam. What are you selling?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: I think that Bourne and Conklin were in business. That Bourne is still involved. And that whatever information I was going to buy in Berlin, it was big enough to make Bourne come out from wherever he's been hiding to kill again.  How's that scan?

turns.speaker: PAMELA/PHONE
turns.text: Mr. Nevins?

turns.speaker: NEVINS/PHONE
turns.text: Who's this?

turns.speaker: PAMELA/PHONE
turns.text: Pamela Landy, again. Where do we stand?

turns.speaker: PAMELA/PHONE
turns.text: How long have you worked for the agency?

turns.speaker: NEVINS/PHONE
turns.text: Me? Four years.

turns.speaker: PAMELA/PHONE
turns.text: If you ever want to make it to five, you're gonna listen to me real close. Jason Bourne is armed and extremely dangerous. A week ago, he assassinated two men in Berlin, one of whom was a highly-experienced field officer...

turns.speaker: PAMELA/PHONE
turns.text: I want that area secured, I want any evidence secured and I want it done now. Is that clear??

turns.speaker: NEVINS/PHONE
turns.text: Yes, sir -- ma'am...

turns.speaker: PAMELA/PHONE
turns.text: I'm getting on a plane to Berlin in 45 minutes, which means you are going to call me back in 30, and when I ask you where we stand, I had better be impressed. My mobile number is...

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: What kind of problems?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Depression. Anger. Compulsive behaviors. They had physical symptoms -- headaches -- sensitivity to light --

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Amnesia?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Before this? Before Bourne? No.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Good luck.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: You were his local contact. You were with him the night Conklin died. You're coming with us.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: I'm curious about Bourne. Your interpretation of his condition. You have specific training in the identification and diagnosis of psychological conditions?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Am I a doctor, no, but...

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Are you an expert in amnesia?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Look, what do you want me to say? I was there. I believed him.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Believed what?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I believed Jason Bourne had suffered a severe traumatic breakdown.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: So he fooled you.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: If you say so.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Not good enough. You're the person who floated this amnesia story.  Ever feel sorry for him? For what he'd been through?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You're making it out like we're friends here or something. I met him alone twice.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: You felt nothing? No spark? Two young people in Paris? Dangerous missions? Life and death?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: You mean, did I want a date?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Did you?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: These were killers. Conklin had them all jacked up. They were Dobermans.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Some women like Dobermans --

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What do you want from me? I was reassigned. I'm out.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: See, that's a problem for me, Nicky. Whatever he's doing, we need to end it. This isn't the kind of mess you walk away from.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I don't think we need to keep looking for him anyway.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: And why is that?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Because he's doing just what he said he'd do. He's coming for us.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Is it fresh?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: It's got caffeine in it. That's all I know.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: What do you think? Is he coming in?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I don't know. He was sick. He wanted out. I believed him.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Alright...

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Let's give him half an hour.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Felt promising. It's a start.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Do we know what this says?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Yup...  The main word there, the file heading, translates as: Treadstone.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: What the hell is a "Treadstone?"

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Anything?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: No. Munich's a bust. He's loose.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Are we locked up?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Black coat, possibly leather. Dark slacks. Dark t-shirt.  He says they're gonna try and corral the guests on the street over there, and then check them out, but...

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Yeah, that'll work...What the hell was he doing here?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Here's what I've got.  Remember Vladimir Neski? Russian politician? Seven years ago, he was due to speak to a group of European Oil ministers here at the hotel. He never did. He was murdered.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: By who?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: His wife. In room 645. Then she shot herself.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Alright... I want you, Kurt and Kim to stay on Bourne, track everything that's out there...

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: We're looking at all Berlin outbound. Good news is, every train station in Berlin has thirty to forty fixed, digital security cameras. Common feed.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: Are we hacking or asking?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Yes. In that order.

turns.speaker: PAMELA
turns.text: And what about you, anything?

turns.speaker: LEADER
turns.text: Someone dead from this household?

turns.speaker: ARGYLE
turns.text: We just had a funeral, isn't that what it means in England as well?

turns.speaker: LEADER
turns.text: What it means in England -- and in Scotland too -- is that rebels have forfeited their lands. We were ambushed last night. But the Scots dragged their dead away.

turns.speaker: ARGYLE
turns.text: My brother and nephew perished two days ago, when their hay cart turned over.

turns.speaker: LEADER
turns.text: Then we'll just have a peek at the wounds.  Dig 'em up!

turns.speaker: ARGYLE
turns.text: They've been sanctified and buried in the holy rites of God's church, and any hand that disturbs them now takes on eternal damnation. So please -- do it.

turns.speaker: ARGYLE
turns.text: We'll sleep here tonight. You'll come home with me. We'll let the house, and the lands too; plenty of willing neighbors.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I don't want to leave.

turns.speaker: ARGYLE
turns.text: Didn't want your father to die either, did ya? But it happened.

turns.speaker: ARGYLE
turns.text: Did the priest say anything about the Resurrection? Or was it all about Judgment?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: It was in Latin, sir.

turns.speaker: ARGYLE
turns.text: Non loquis Latinum? You don't speak Latin? We have to fix that, won't we?  Did he give the poetic benediction? The Lord bless thee and keep thee? Patris Benefactum et --  ...It was Malcolm's favorite.
